Fields.DialogueText: Capitán, you wanted to see me?

Fields.MenuText: Did I? Are you sure you weren't just running around the ship and decided to pop in for no reason?
Yes, please come in.
I did, but you know what? I changed my mind.

Fields.DialogueText: Honestly, Capitán, you're not usually this forgetful.
What's going on? You seem a little off.
You're not getting rid of me that easily. What do you want?
Sorry, I... I think I might be coming down with something.
¡Oh no! Should I get some help? Do you need a nurse? A doctor? Chicken soup?
I'll be fine! There's no need to worry.
I'd be a horrible person if I wasn't worried. You're my capitán, after all.
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. You should be worrying about the Morganas. They'll kill everyone on the ship otherwise.
Kill?! You're going to die?!
No, no. Let's just go.
All right, Capitán. But afterwards, I'll be worrying about you again.
Phew, that was close. I don't know why, but I just froze up when I thought about giving her the carnation. What am I going to do?
@BATTLE
All right, she'll come in and I'll have to hand it to her. As long as she gets it, mission accomplished.
I can do this. If I can fight Morganas, then I can give a flower to a girl.
Ugh! I can do this! I'm a captain of a ship, not a child!
Capitán, why are you shouting about children?
Oh, uh, Velasco.

Fields.MenuText: Nothing! I said nothing, I have nothing.
Here! For you.
Here! Catch!

Fields.DialogueText: Are you... hiding something from me?
All right. Is there a reason we're holding hands now?
Uh, what was that you just threw behind your desk?
@BATTLE
No. I just stand like this sometimes.
I've never seen you stand like that before.
I only do it for special occasions.
So what's the special occasion now?
The special occasion is... we have Morganas heading this way! We should go deal with them.
Really? The alarm hasn't sounded, but if you say so, let's go!
*sigh*
No, no, I'm giving you what's in my hands.
I'm pretty sure your hands are empty. So should we stop holding hands now?
I mean...
Did you say something, Capitán?
We... have Morganas heading this way! We should go deal with them.
Really? The alarm hasn't sounded, but if you say so, let's go!
*sigh* ...Where did the flower go?
Would you believe... a very tiny Morgana?
No, I would not.
Don't come crying to me when the miniature invasion starts. I'll be here, telling you I told you so.
If that invasion ever starts, I'll be in the thick of it, stomping Morganas like bugs.
Speak of the devil, that must be the tiny Morgana swarm now.
I swear, if there are mini Morganas attacking...
I really need to work on my aim...
A magical girl... who has powers and... inhabits a Spanish destroyer.
She should be asleep now. It's the perfect time to leave the carnation at her door.
Should I write a note?
*ALARM*
Dammit! I’ll have to do it later. Let’s hope she takes her afterlunch run as usual.
@BATTLE
I should've done this when she was asleep.
I'll be quick about it. I just need to make sure she knows what it represents.
Hey, Captain. What are you up to over there?
Ehh...

Fields.MenuText: I'm... just here to enjoy the view.
Uh, I've... got to go!
I was just in need of a walk. Good for thinking, you know?

Fields.DialogueText: Right, the terrific view we have... down here...
Is it my breath?
Yeah, I've been doing some thinking myself.
Captain, before you go, I've had some ideas about the ship menu I thought I might run by you.
Really?
You have some time, don't you?
I guess. Let's go talk in my quarters.
I've had worse.
Finally! I have my note and the carnation in a box I think Velasco will like. Everything is ready.
Wait... yes, it's still in the box.
All right, I'll just walk by, nonchalantly, and drop it off at her door. Nothing will stop me this time.
There. Perfect. Mission accomplished.
Capitán, I hardly ever see you around here. ¿Qué haces?
Uh, I was just taking a walk...

Fields.MenuText: I noticed there's a box by your door.
I like to come here sometimes and enjoy the view.
You know, it's like running at a slower pace.

Fields.DialogueText: A box? That's strange. I'll check it out later.
The view, huh? I mean, I've seen better.
I know what walking is, even if I'd never personally engage in the activity. Running at full speed is more my style.
How are you feeling? You're not still sick, are you?
I'm fine, really. I think it was just a bug.
So you're feeling fine enough to, say, fight a few Morganas?
Is that your way of saying we have Morganas nearby?
If you're feeling up to it, then yes.
I'm feeling up to it.
@BATTLE
Capitán, something's happened!

Fields.MenuText: Velasco, what's wrong? You're shaking.
It must be serious if you're shouting like that. Then again, you also shout like that when it's time for lunch.
Morganas?! Sound the alarm!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm shaking because it's so big. It's so... embarrassing.
This is a lot more serious than food. It's... love.
No. Cálmate por favor. This is bigger than Morganas. This is romance. Love, Capitán.
Love? What's going on?
Well, I got a present. Isn't that exciting? I love presents! So I took a moment to appreciate the box it was in, and the wrapping. It was all rather lovely.
Before I opened it, I discovered this note. It says, "I hope this tells you how I feel about you." Then when I opened the box, I found this gorgeous carnation inside.
Red carnations are symbols for love. Do you know what this means?
Well, I...
I have a secret admirer!
Wait, secret admirer?
The note wasn't signed. Someone on this ship likes me.
*ALARM*
I hope the Morganas like my new accessory. Hey, Morganas, look at this!
I forgot to sign the note... I can't believe it. How stupid am I?
@BATTLE
Velasco, what are you doing with that notebook?
I'm trying to figure out who my secret admirer is. Frankly, it could be any member of the crew.

Fields.MenuText: They could've left their name off the note for a reason.
Who're the top candidates?
So you're a detective now?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it was probably a stupid reason.
I'm still trying to collect all the candidates. I'm not ruling anyone out yet.
I like the sound of that. Velasco, the Detective of Love.
You're not going to stop until you figure this out, are you?
Nope. I want to know.
*Phew*
Hmmm, did you say something?
Um, what are you going to do when you find out your admirer's identity?
I haven't actually thought about that yet. I guess I'll have to let them down gently.
Let them down? I thought you wanted to find them so you could reciprocate their feelings.
Why would I do that? No, I just don't want them pining after me if they don't have a chance.
So you're not looking for romance right now?
I didn't say that, Capitán. I just think I already have feelings for someone in particular.
Is that a fact?
Morganas spotted! All hands to battle stations!
Oh, I forgot to write that name down.
You can write it down later. We have Morganas to fight!
@BATTLE
She has feelings for someone else... why didn't I even consider that possibility?
First, I bought that flower without thinking, then I forgot to sign the note, and now I'm standing here, complaining.
That'll teach me to make impulse buys.
Capitán, are you bu... are you all right? You look upset.

Fields.MenuText: I'm fine.
My last meal didn't agree with my stomach.
What, can't your captain show some emotion now and then?

Fields.DialogueText: It's all right, Captain. I think I know what this about.
I know what you mean. The food on board is hit or miss.
Oh! Um, no, Captain. In fact, I have a story to tell you.
No, it's fine, I...
So for lunch, I had my usual. Typically, I take my tomatoes on the side, and every once in a while, I get a side of carrots.
This time, they put my tomatoes and carrots inside the sandwich. Like I'm some kind of animal! Can you believe that?
No. No, I can't. That must have been, um, a real shock.
So when I confronted the staff about their mistake, they just...
*ALARM*
(Thank the heavens for those Morganas. This is my chance to flee.)
@BATTLE
Hmmm, could it be... No, I think he fancies that medic. Maybe it's...
Velasco, do you have to sort through your findings here? I'm trying to concentrate.
Of course I have to do it here! You're the perfect sounding board.

Fields.MenuText: But you've hardly said a word to me.
Maybe I don't want to help you with that.
I'm sure you know someone else who can serve in that capacity.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I know you're busy. I don't want to bother you unnecessarily.
Why wouldn't you? It's really fun.
Maybe, but I'd prefer to do it with you.
Fine, let's go through this list of yours.
¡Hurra! I knew you'd come around.
Capitán, we've spotted Morganas to the south.
Thank you, Lieutenant Garro. Please sound the alarm.
I guess we'll go over my list afterwards.
Was she on your list?
No.
It's a secret admirer, Velasco. It could be anyone.
This is going to be more work than I thought.
@BATTLE
So it's definitely not him.
And if that's the case, we can rule her out, too. You know, this is going a lot faster than I would've thought.

Fields.MenuText: I guess people don't like you as much as you think.
Well, teamwork can make all the difference.
At this rate, you'll find your admirer before you know it.

Fields.DialogueText: People adore me. They just aren't necessarily all in love with me.
And we're quite the team, aren't we?
Thanks to you. I'd still be at the beginning of my list if I didn't have your help.
So do you think it could be...
*ALARM*
There's the alarm. One thing's for sure, your admirer isn't a Morgana.
Eso es bueno. We might as well blow a few holes in them then.
@BATTLE
One person does. And we'll find them before long.
The Morganas would certainly say so.
Well, I'm always here when you need a hand.
Hey, Velasco. Are you here to go through a few more names before heading over to the mess?
No, I've been doing some thinking. Now I'm not sure I want to find my secret admirer.
Why?
I'm not sure I want to break their heart. I don't want them to hate me.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure they could never hate you, Velasco.
Let's not get carried away. I'm sure they'll be fine. At most, you'll bruise their heart.
Yeah, they'll probably hate you after you're done with them. Maybe even more than the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you sure, Capitán?
I'm not sure whether I should take that as a compliment or an insult.
Don't say that, Capitán. I already feel bad enough, as it is.
I'm not even sure what I'm going to say to them.
Well, do you want to practice?
Practice? Like on you?
Sure. I can be your secret admirer. You can tell me you like someone else until you get used to it.
That might actually help.
*ALARM*
Though, it sounds like we'll have to deal with some Morganas first.
@BATTLE
You know I’m joking, Velasco. No one could hate you.
All right, Velasco, do your worst.
Are you sure about this, Capitán?

Fields.MenuText: I'm an adult. I can take it.
Yes. And that's an order.
No, but let's do it anyway.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, you're right. It's just strange.
I guess I do have to do it, then.
You're not filling me with confidence, Capitán.
You're usually so sure of yourself, Velasco. Why is this situation any different?
Well... I don't really have a lot of experience with... this.
With romance? Or with disappointing people?
Both. It's really unsettling.
Now that I think about it, that makes sense. All the more reason to practice.
Bueno. So what do I do?
Just imagine I'm your secret admirer. Maybe I walk up to you with another carnation and confess my love for you. What do you do?
Velasco?
Morganas!
Was she... blushing?
@BATTLE
That... was a great... run! WHEW! I... needed... that.

Fields.MenuText: Dying... *collapse*
I... yeah... running...
Why... were we... doing that... again?

Fields.DialogueText: Stop overreacting, Capitán. You only joined me halfway.
It's a great way to relieve stress.
I needed a break from all this admirer stuff. Sometimes it's nice to forget about all your problems and enjoy the sea breeze.
And you might be interested to know that I've made a realization.
What's that... realization?
This whole experience has made me realize that... maybe I should confess my own feelings.
I thought you weren't sure about your feelings.
I'm pretty sure. Sure enough.
Captain, we have Morganas to north.
Well, I'm pretty sure we have to deal with these Morganas before we tackle your love life.
Luckily, that's where the big guns come in handy.
@BATTLE
Well, Velasco is going to confess her feelings to... whomever she has feelings for. It hurts, but it's most important that she's happy.
I think I need to find a hobby.
*ALARM*
There's that alarm again. Those Morganas never quit.
@BATTLE
Wooo! Capitán, that was a great fight wasn't it? And this is shaping up to be quite the post-battle celebration!

Fields.MenuText: That fight was something. You were a wonder out there.
It seems like the Morganas keep getting stronger.
I'm not sure I'm up for a rowdy party, at this point.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you... drunk? Your face is flushed
Well, we're getting stronger too. I'm sure we'll overtake them soon enough.
Capitán, you sound exhausted! Are you all right?
Well, try to enjoy yourself. I have some energy left from the battle, I'm going to go run a few laps.
I'm going to have to get over this, sooner or later.
Uh, sure. Yes. I'm drunk.
Well, you've earned the right to party.
I'm sure you're right. Together we'll defeat them.
I'm fine. That battle must have just taken a lot out of me.
Capitán, I did it! I finally did it!
What did you do?
I figured out who my secret admirer is!

Fields.MenuText: Y-you did?
I seriously doubt it.
So, who do you think it is?

Fields.DialogueText: It finally came to me. I was looking over the list and everything suddenly clicked.
You should know better than to doubt me by now, Capitán.
Don't say it like that. I don't just think. I know.
There was a very short period of time between my leaving my room and returning that the flower could have been left by my door.
During that time period, from what I saw around me, most of the crew wouldn't have been anywhere near my room. Only a select few could've left it.
And of those few, one name stood out.
Capitán, we have Morganas heading our way.
Thanks, Martínez, sound the alarm.
Psst! That was him, Capitán!
What, Martínez? You think he's your secret admirer? The guy obsessed with lunch?
I don't know about lunch, but it has to be him.
@BATTLE
Capitán, you sent for me?
Yeah, I wanted to ask a favor of you.
A favor? Sure, anything. Is this about yesterday's fish?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. Except no, not at all.
What is it with you and lunch?
No, it has to do with Velasco.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha, good one. So what do you need?
I don't know. A better question is "why does the mess have it in for me?" Anyway, what was that favor you needed?
Oh, well, she did eat a lot of the fish yesterday. She seems to love that seafood.
Velasco has gotten it into her head that you... have feelings for her.
Oh! Awkward.
Well, I want to avoid any awkwardness, if possible.
So what do you need me to do?
I just want you to let her "let you down easy." She'll just tell you she doesn't feel the same way as you and I don't want you to argue.
But... I don't like her. So if she doesn't feel the same way... then she does like me?
Don't think about it too much.
I think I get it... but what's in it for me?

Fields.MenuText: I'll let you decide the lunch menu for a week.
How about a four course meal of your design?
Extra servings at meals for two weeks?

Fields.DialogueText: Deal!
Deal!
Deal!
*ALARM*
It's settled, then. Now, we'd better be on our way.
@BATTLE
So, Velasco, are you ready to break some hearts?
Actually, I was hoping we might be able to practice before I get to the real thing.
Oh, sure.
Gracias. Whenever you're ready.
Oh, now?
The sooner the better.
All right. *ahem*

Fields.MenuText: Hey, Velasco. Gawsh, you're so attractive. Here's some flowers I picked for you.
Well, hellooooo there, Velasco. I just picked you some roses. No big deal.
Hi, Velasco. I just wanted to tell you how amazing I think you are. I've seen you wearing the carnation I got you, so I thought I'd get you another dozen.

Fields.DialogueText: What's with that voice? You sound like a child.
Are you, *stifled laughter* trying to act suave?
Aww, you don't have to make this so hard, Capitán. It's not like he'll have flowers for me when I confront him.
All right... *sigh* I'm sorry, but I have feelings for someone else.
*ALARM*
Sounds like you made the alarm angry.
That or there are Morganas nearby.
Probably that second one. But, you did well. I think you might be ready.
@BATTLE
It's my first "love" voice. Now break my heart.
Pft, maybe. It's no big thing. So do you want to go steady, or what?
Probably not, but you'll be thanking me if he does. Now come on and let me down easy already. I can't pretend to hold flowers all day.
I think I'm ready, Capitán.

Fields.MenuText: Me, too. I'm pretty hungry.
To confront your secret admirer?
You sound confident.

Fields.DialogueText: Not for lunch. To confront my secret admirer! To let him down easy, remember?
Exactly. I think it's time I told him I have feelings for someone else.
I am. I think all that practice worked. I'm not really nervous at all.
Should I bring him in now?
No time like the present.
All right, I'll go get him.
No, wait. There are Morganas nearby to the east.
Are there really?
Sí, Capitán. Yes, of course! I wouldn't lie.
It just seems... convenient, if you ask me.
I'm not nervous! As soon as we beat these Morganas, I'll prove it.
I look forward to that.
@BATTLE
Capitán, you needed me?
Actually, I wanted to speak to you.
Oh! Is this the...

Fields.MenuText: *cough dramatically*
Should I leave, give you two some privacy?
Nope. Let the lady speak.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you all right, Capitán? That didn't sound good.
No, that's all right. You can stay.
You sound angry, Capitán. Are you all right?
So, what's going on, Velasco?
I know that you left me this beautiful carnation, and I know that it means you have feelings for me. It's very sweet, but I just don't feel the same way about you.
I, um, understand.
Please don't take it too hard. I just have feelings for someone else.
It's all right. I'm sure I'll find the fortitude to move on eventually. Farewell, milady.
Did he wink at me when he left the room?
You must be seeing things.
*ALARM*
Am I hearing things, too, or is that the alarm?
No, that's definitely the alarm.
@BATTLE
I'm fine. Some water went down the wrong pipe is all.
All right. Pretend I'm not even here, then.
I'm fine. Just get it over with.
That didn't really go how I was expecting.
The confrontation? What did you expect?
No lo sé. I guess, I just expected him to be more upset, maybe.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure he was hiding his real pain.
Maybe he didn't like you as much as you thought.
He's probably already moved on to the next girl.

Fields.DialogueText: You certainly have a high opinion of me. Thanks, Capitán.
I guess. Maybe I blew this whole thing out of proportion.
I'm not sure if that's an insult toward me or him. Either way, shame on you, Capitán.
Morganas incoming!
Sound the alarm.
That's his voice over the loudspeaker. He seems... fine.
I guess that means you have no reason to feel bad about anything.
I guess you're right. Though I might feel a little bad about what I'm about to do to these Morganas...
Hahaha! Of course not!
@BATTLE
You've earned it.
You do have a tendency to take things and run with them.
Yeah... I deserved that.
Really?
Capitán, have you ever been in love before?
That's a random question. Why do you ask?
Well, I was just thinking about how best to confess my feelings, and I was wondering if you had any tips.
Oh.

Fields.MenuText: Tip number one: hygiene. It matters.
I've never really confessed love to someone before. I've always been too shy.
I've had dozens of relationships. If you want tips, you've come to the right place.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll make sure I smell like roses beforehand, thank you.
You? Shy? You've never been shy around the Morganas
When you put it like that, I'm not sure I want any tips from you.
*ALARM*
That's the alarm. I guess we can finish this conversation later.
@BATTLE
That's a different kind of shy altogether. Love and war require different skill sets.
I suppose you have a point. I can blow a hole through just about any enemy, but I seem to be useless when it comes to matters of the heart.
You're not useless! Velasco, you've gotten much bet–
Fine, but don't come crying to me when you realize that my vast knowledge would have come in handy.
Tip number two: a little mood music goes a long way.
That's actually a very good tip.
Tip number three: always–
Have you noticed something strange about the mess lately?

Fields.MenuText: Food complaints? Not you, too.
Yeah, I keep hearing odd things.
As far as I'm concerned, as long as we still have food, everything's fine.

Fields.DialogueText: What do you mean? I've just noticed that the chefs seem kind of angry.
Odd things? Like what? I just thought the chefs looked a little angry.
Yeah, but the chefs have seemed kind of angry. You don't want the people serving you food to be upset.
Well, I did rope them into a little extra work.
What kind of extra work?
I made a deal with an officer on board. In hindsight, I should've talked to them about it first.
So you lost a bet?
No, it was a deal. He got something, I got something.
So what did you get?
*ALARM*
By the sounds of it, I got more Morganas.
You definitely got the bad end of that deal.
@BATTLE
So... are you ever going to tell me who the lucky person is?
Lucky person?
You know, whoever it is you have feelings for.
Oh. I don't know. Maybe I'll make you guess.

Fields.MenuText: I'm never going to guess. Although, I guess I could go through the crew alphabetically...
Or you could be nice and tell me. I think I've earned it.
Is it Jenkins?

Fields.DialogueText: That would take quite a while. Though, I suppose you'd find the right answer eventually.
Hmmm, does that sound like me?
Nope.
Come on, give me a hint.
I think you'd enjoy this person's company...
*ALARM*
What? Did you say something? That alarm has horrible timing.
No importa. Let's go fight some Morganas!
I think she said...
@BATTLE
Could she have said... No. But... maybe? Oh, I don't know. Am I crazy?
Hey, Capitán, how's it going? I am stuffed!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, great, you're here.
Actually, you have good timing. I need a little advice.
No more problems with lunch?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, I am pretty great. Thanks, Capitán. What's up with you? You seem more smiley than usual.
I'm always here when you need someone to talk to, Capitán. Ask me anything.
No. Not at all. That deal worked out perfectly for me. So what are you up to?
I'm having... girl issues.
Well, that isn't one of my specialties, but I'll do my best.
There's this girl. I thought she didn't have feelings for me, but now I'm not so sure. What do I do?
Oh, wow, I don't know. Ask her?
How did I never think of that? You're a genius.
No need to be snippy. Why not just tell her how you feel and hope for the best?
If she didn't feel the same way, our current situation might become more... complex.
Oh, is she a member of the crew? Naughty capitán...
Go stuff your face some more. You're no help.
All right, just remember that girls love chocolates and flowers. If my father taught me one thing, that's it.
Hmmm... flowers... she seemed to like them before.
Oh, Capitán. Sorry, but I forgot, I came in here to tell you something. We have Morganas approaching from the south.
Are you serious?! All that food is going straight to your brain.
No. I think it's going to my stomach.
Just sound the alarm.
@BATTLE
Hey, Capitán, are you busy? I could use your help for a second.
I just finished up. What do you need?
Would you let me practice on you again?
You want to let me down easy... again?
Actually, I need practice confessing.
Oh.
I keep trying, but... whenever I think about telling this person how I feel... I don't know, my stomach fills with this fluttery feeling.
This is a new side to you, Velasco. Usually there's not much that fazes you.
So does that mean you'll help me or not?

Fields.MenuText: I'm always here to help you, Velasco.
I'm not sure I like being your training dummy...
All right, but this is the last time.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. Gracias, Capitán.
Just this one last time? Please?
All right, that's fine. Gracias, Capitán.
Well, go ahead.
I've never been in love before, but when I try and imagine how it must feel... it's familiar. It's how I feel about you.
I think I have feelings for you. I'm happy whenever I'm with you, and when I'm not with you, I'm thinking about the next time I'll see you.
I know this might seem strange, and I'll understand if you don't feel the same way. But I had to tell you.
That's... well...
*ALARM*
That's the alarm.
Wait, Velasco!
Come on, Capitán, there are Morganas waiting for us to defeat them!
Was... was that her real confession?
@BATTLE
All right, this is perfect. If she thought one carnation was a declaration of love, a dozen ought to send the right message.
Whew! Let's head out...
Hola, Capitán. I was just...
Capitán, what's in that box?
Is that a bouquet?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe...
Yes. It's for you.
Bouquet? What bouquet?

Fields.DialogueText: Is it for me?
For me?
I already saw it, Capitán. Who is it for?
I saw these and I thought of you. In fact... when I first saw that red carnation in Cartagena, I knew it was perfect for you.
Wait, the first carnation? You mean you were my secret admirer? But Martínez...
Yeah, I made a deal with him. I didn't want you to find out it was me, only to let me down easy.
And yet now you're telling me... what exactly?
Carnations are a symbol for love. I once heard that the darker the red, the deeper the love. These were the deepest red I could find.
Oh... Capitán...
You never told me what was in the box.
Well, it seems silly now... I mean you got a whole dozen. I only brought one for you.
So... should I take that to mean?
I feel the same way about you, Capitán. You should've just told me you were my secret admirer!
I didn't even mean to be secret. I just forgot to write my name.
Haha! Oh, you're hopeless, you know that?
And yet, here I am with a beautiful flower from a lovely girl.
And here I am with a dozen from a dashing capitán.
*ALARM*
I think you're making the Morganas jealous.
They'll have to tear these flowers from my cold, dead hands!
Wait, don't take the flowers to fight! They're not a weapon!
@BATTLE
